intro: Cissampelos pareira var. australis, commonly known as the Australian climbing bignay, is a variant of the species native to parts of Australia and Southeast Asia. It is a woody vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically orange to reddish in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
